intro: Coccoloba petrophila, commonly known as the rock beauty gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, including parts of the Greater Antilles and the Bahamas. This herbaceous perennial is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically yellow or red in color.
